meanings.definition: The quality or state of being bitter.
meanings.sent1: The bitternesses of the medicine made the child frown.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide the bitternesses in her voice when she spoke about the betrayal.
meanings.sent3: The bitternesses of the burnt cookies made them taste like charcoal.
meanings.sent4: The bitternesses of winter lingered in the air long after the snow had melted.
meanings.sent5: The bitternesses of the dark chocolate left a lasting impression on her taste buds.

meanings.definition: Resentment or cynicism resulting from past experiences.
meanings.sent1: His bitternesses towards his former boss affected his job performance.
meanings.sent2: The bitternesses in her heart slowly faded as she forgave those who had wronged her.
meanings.sent3: Despite his bitternesses, he couldn't help but smile at the puppy's antics.
meanings.sent4: The bitternesses in her words cut deeper than any knife.
meanings.sent5: The bitternesses of the old rivalry resurfaced when they met again after years.
